L7p:Comment.stringValue: === If you have the need to customize this policy
=== please contact CA APIM Support so we can improve customization capability
This fragment shall only be used as encapsulated assertion which has the same name.
This encapsulated assertion is used at the OAuth 2.0 authorization endpoint.
It validates the given parameters of the incoming response_type request.
The authorization endpoint will check the response, it will either be 'valid' or 'invalid'.

L7p:value.stringValue: Verify the client is not using a master key.

L7p:Detail.stringValue: Given client_id is invalid: '${client_key}'. It may be DISABLED or EXPIRED, status: '${xpathStatus.result}', or marked as 'Master Key' (client_id == client_secret)

L7p:value.stringValue: And validate expiration the and status

L7p:Comment.stringValue: If redirect_uri parameter is passed in, then it must match redirect_uri entered during client registration.

L7p:RegexName.stringValue: Check that redirect_uri is an absolute URI

L7p:value.stringValue: Check that redirect_uri does not include a fragment component

L7p:Comment.stringValue: If redirect_uri parameter is not passed in, then use redirect_uri entered during client registration.

L7p:RegexName.stringValue: Check that redirect_uri is an absolute URI
Check that redirect_uri is just one absolute URI

L7p:value.stringValue: Check that redirect_uri does not include a fragment component

L7p:Comment.stringValue: If redirect_uri parameter is passed and none was registered use the one passed in

L7p:RegexName.stringValue: Check that redirect_uri is an absolute URI

L7p:Detail.stringValue: OPEN REDIRECT_URI! Should NOT be supported. Given: '${given_redirect_uri}'

L7p:value.stringValue: Check that redirect_uri does not include a fragment component
DISABLE TO SUPPORT OPEN REDIRECT_URIs. This is NOT recommended

L7p:Comment.stringValue: Public clients must have registered redirect_uri
Confidential clients utilizing implicit grant_type must have registered redirect_uri

L7p:Detail.stringValue: The combination of client type and response_type requires a registered redirect_uri: client_id: '${client_key}', client_type: '${xpathType.result}', response_type: '${response_type}'

L7p:value.stringValue: check on the client type. There is a difference between confidantial and public clients
SCOPE openid is not valid for MAC token profile
// check if the client registered dynamically and verify the requested response_type is valid for it
